坦白講我又唔覺佢無中距 pullup 係一個「好明顯嘅缺點」
NCAA 條三分線近 d，Lonzo 好多 NCAA pullup 三分係 NBA 都會係 long 2 出手
打 P&R 有 long 2 + 三分已經可以好煞食，mid range 反而無咁重要
只佔 3% 的確係有 d 低，不過好似 Lowry Harden 呢類 P&R 打法一般都係佔少過 10%

至於你話點解放 tier 1，一黎好似前面咁講佢 open court awareness 真係好勁
佢傳波無 Simmons 咁好，但係都算好 elite
你再拎 Lonzo 同 JJ Fox 比就知邊個缺點更明顯
JJ 遠距離出手唔穩定，wingspan 短對防守好不利
Fox 直頭三分中距咩都無，人地下下守 P&R go under 你跑得幾快都無用

係你兩個理解錯左姐
唔係 3% 中距命中率，而係 half court setting 入面只有 3% 出手係三分線內跳投 (要考慮係 NCAA 條三分線)，唔關命中率事

呢種打法啱曬呢個年代嘅 NBA，一係射三分、一係 attack the rim
就算最尾真係學唔到 mid range pullup shot，打 P&R 一樣可以好 elite
Lowry 咪又係呢種打法，極少中距跳投，P&R 能力一樣係好


我夠知係講緊FGA, 個比例會唔會太extreme先
講多次由頭到尾冇話佢好廢，不過覺得怪明明有咁明顯缺點都放到上tier 1啫
對比Fultz 啲缺點明顯好多


坦白講我又唔覺佢無中距 pullup 係一個「好明顯嘅缺點」
NCAA 條三分線近 d，Lonzo 好多 NCAA pullup 三分係 NBA 都會係 long 2 出手
打 P&R 有 long 2 + 三分已經可以好煞食，mid range 反而無咁重要
只佔 3% 的確係有 d 低，不過好似 Lowry Harden 呢類 P&R 打法一般都係佔少過 10%

至於你話點解放 tier 1，一黎好似前面咁講佢 open court awareness 真係好勁
佢傳波無 Simmons 咁好，但係都算好 elite
你再拎 Lonzo 同 JJ Fox 比就知邊個缺點更明顯
JJ 遠距離出手唔穩定，wingspan 短對防守好不利
Fox 直頭三分中距咩都無，人地下下守 P&R go under 你跑得幾快都無用

利申：有得簡我都簡 Fultz

jj 身高6呎8, 6呎10wingspan 都叫短
唔長，但一定唔係短
你話佢手細，有d 動作limit 左做唔到都有得講

Ball 打PnR 出名差
half court 創造進攻都唔係出色
open court 係nba 占好少部分

仲有，根本主要concern唔係出手比例
係佢個射姿好多限制性
永遠只係可以向左移/catch and shoot 先射得到
nba 好少少既防守球員，封佢左邊，基本上佢已經食得屎
lowry harden 一來進攻能力係強好多，二來佢地唔係射唔到，只係唔射，係好大分別

撲籃球5月19日訊據The Vertical知名記者Adrian Wojnarowski在節目中透露，湖人非常有信心在2018年得到保羅-喬治，無論屆時他是待在步行者還是被交易到了其他地方。

“他們並不需要放棄他們的資產，來試圖交易得到他，事實上，我認為他們應該去做相反的事情，”Woj說道，“如果保羅-喬治要來你湖人，他會希望你們留下這些資產，他希望他來的時候能夠看到一支出色的球隊。”

假如喬治在今天入選了NBA最佳陣容，他將符合指定老將條款（虎撲籃球百科：“指定老將條款>>”），有資格在步行者得到一份5年2.07億美元的頂薪合同（在新勞資協議之下），與此同時，像湖人這樣的非母隊只能在休賽季給他提供一份4年1.3億美元的合同。

From Sam Smith NBA.Com.

Quote:
The Lakers also would love to dump one of those big contracts that resulted in a management change. The talk among general managers is you can pretty easily get D’Angelo Russell and Julius Randle. Then simple. You give the Pacers Luol Deng to match salary with George and then throw in two former lottery picks, one from the Big 10 and the other from nearby Kentucky, and the Pacers can sell that as a rebuild. You think Larry Bird was leaving if they weren’t going to rebuild? The Pacers maybe send someone useable back. Maybe Glenn Robinson. Maybe C.J. Miles if he doesn’t opt out. The Pacers need to get something and the Lakers are the only team that can afford to give.

“I wouldn’t personally, but yes, somebody in our organization will, absolutely.”

Walton also added that he isn’t concerned about LaVar Ball right now and will think about it more as the draft gets closer:

“Not yet. When we get closer to the draft, we’ll get a packet of information on every player that we’re really interested in, and then we’ll sit down and discuss it all. But right now I’m not concerned at all; I’m mostly concerned with what player can help us win more than 26 games the most.”

The Lakers Still Uncertain Who They’ll Select in the Draft.
_
According to Chris McGee of @spectrumsportsnet -
"I absolutely do not think it's a foregone conclusion, I actually think it's probably 50/50, 60/40 in favor of Ball in the Lakers front office,” McGee said during an appearance on the Locked on Lakers podcast.
_
“Guys love De'Aaron Fox in that front office, because what's there not to love? The kid is one of the best athletes in the draft. He's 6'4, I know he's skinny but he's got good length. [Kentucky Head Coach John] Calipari will tell you he's as fast as John Wall with the ball.”
_
“Josh Jackson they love too, and so do I. So there's three really good guys you're going to be looking at, at number two,” McGee said.
_
"No one has ever come out in that front office and said ‘it's Lonzo,’ and they're not going to do that anyway, but people I talk to say without a doubt that those are the three guys they absolutely love,” (H/T SB Nation)
